Authors: Mengli Zhu, Xin Zhao, Zefeng Jia
Title:
A new species of Fellhanera (Pilocarpaceae) from China, with
notes on other eight Chinese Fellhanera
Keywords:
Lichenized fungi, foliicolous lichens, taxonomy, DNA
sequencing, Asia
Abstract:
Fellhanera filiformis is described as new to science,
collected from southern China. It is characterized by its elongated,
predominantly 7-septate, sometimes 9-11-septate ascospores without
constricted septa. The mtSSU sequence analysis supports the taxon as a
distinct species. The following eight Fellhanera species reported from
China are discussed: F. bouteillei, F. fuscatula, F. rhaphidophylli, F.
semecarpi, F. subternella, F. subfuscatula, F. subtilis and F.
viridisorediata, and a key to nine Chinese Fellhanera species is
provided.
